name: Fluid Attack - Quantumania (Team-Up)
description_md: ### **_Synopsis:_** _This deck is a strong, thematic build that utilizes Ant-Man's ability to increase his basic attack with [Giant Strength](/card/12009) and [Fluid Motion](/card/28016), then using that increased ATK multiple times a turn with [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022), [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022), and [Quick Strike](/card/25018)._ _________ - **Multiplayer:** This deck is especially thematic with multiplayer in mind for my Wasp deck: [Recur & Inspire Wasp - Quantumania (Team-Up)](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/26807/recur-inspire-quantumania-team-up-1.0) - If playing both decks, remove [Quincarrier](/card/08023) for another [Quick Strike](/card/25018) or another lower-cost ally for [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) like [Valkyrie](/card/06012). _________ ________ ### **_Max ATK:_** - Utilize [Giant Strength](/card/12009) x2 when you flip to Giant-form to increase your strength by 2. - [Fluid Motion](/card/28016) combines with low-cost events aided by [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) to increase your strength by another 2-4. ([Surprise Attack](/card/13014) is 0 cost when using [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) and Ant-Man is easy to flip. - [Combat Training](/card/01057) adds another +1 ATK. _________ ### **_Ideal Play:_** - With [Resize](/card/12005) and/or [Swarm Tactics](/card/12020) you'd like to flip from Tiny-form to Giant-form twice for +4 ATK, while playing as many low-cost (attack) events as you can, e.g. [Surprise Attack](/card/13014) or [Quick Strike](/card/25018). - You'll trigger [Fluid Motion](/card/28016) with those low-cost events for another +2 ATK. - With [Combat Training](/card/01057) down, you'll have around +7 ATK (10 ATK total). Your [Quick Strike](/card/25018) will have hit pretty hard with that increased attack. - Finally, with low-cost allies down you'll be able to then basic attack for 10 damage, and hopefully have a [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) in hand to swing again for another 10 damage or so. - [Swarm Tactics](/card/12020) and [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022) will also hopefully have contributed to another swing for you near that max damage. _________ ### **_Theme!:_** - In the spirit of Quantumania, you'll have two ally Wasp targets for [Swarm Tactics](/card/12020) when playing solo. All the Avengers have come out to play. - I've tested this deck extensively, especially with Kang Expert and the MODOK modular with smooth sailing. _________ _**I've had a ton of fun with this deck, the set-up is quick and the combos are pretty easy to pull off. Once built, you're doing so much damage, the game ends pretty quickly with some pretty insane attack turns a true Aggression player would appreciate! Hope you have fun and appreciate the theme if you give it a try!**_ _________

name: Recur & Inspire - Quantumania (Team-Up)
description_md: ### **_Synopsis:_** - _This deck is a strong, thematic build that utilizes Alter-Ego G.I.R.L. Action to constantly recur both allies and events that then heal and ready those allies. You'll flip to alter-ego and choose what card you need for that moment to recur._ - _You'll use specific allies and events that all combo with each other and will all be able to be recurred using Wasp's alter-ego action._ ________ - **Multiplayer:** This deck is especially thematic with multiplayer in mind for my Quantumania Ant-Man deck: [Fluid Attack Ant-Man - Quantumania (Team-Up)](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/26807/recur-inspire-quantumania-team-up-1.0) - If playing both decks, remove [Quincarrier](/card/08023) from Ant-Man for another [Quick Strike](/card/25018) or another lower-cost ally for [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) like [Valkyrie](/card/06012). _________ _________ ### **_Recursion:_** - Allies: [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013), [Black Panther](/card/01040a), Power Man, [Goliath](/card/04013), Ant-Man, and U.S. Agent will all be able to be recurred. - Events: [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) and [First Aid](/card/01086) will be recurred so that you can heal those allies and ready them. _________ ### **_Allies:_** - [Giant-Man](/card/12012) although not a is great in this deck, not to mention a great thematic addition. Hank Pym was actually the original Giant-Man! This ally is also quite effective in this deck in that you'll always be able to swing for 4-5 ATK. Late game this is an ideal target for [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) and [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018). (Check out the art on the suit!). [Teamwork](/card/06032) is another card that ensures your max attack by artificially increasing his health. - [Goliath](/card/04013) is another hero whose moniker was originally Hank Pym. You'll also get the most out of his ability with multiple attacks of 5-6 ATK with [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030). Wait for the right time to use his action, he's actually an excellent thwarter, especially with [Mighty Avengers](/card/21015) down. - Power-Man is yet another recursion target that's also an ideal target for [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) to get the most out of his action of increased ATK in a phase. - [Black Panther](/card/01040a) is a recursion target that can also get you [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) when you haven't yet drawn it or recurred it. - U.S. Agent actually is not a bad target for [First Aid](/card/01086) or [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) when you have [Mighty Avengers](/card/21015) down. He'll usually be able to soak up at least one hit or two from the villain for you. Also, don't be afraid to experiment and sub a card for [Ready for Action](/card/04017), which is a you'll be able to recur. - You'll be able to get multiple allies out with [Stinger](/card/12014), [Avengers Tower](/card/03024), and [The Triskelion](/card/01073). _____ ### **_Events:_** - [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) is the main ready/heal you're going to be recurring with Wasp's AE-action. Once you have an ally like [Giant-Man](/card/12012), [Goliath](/card/04013), or Power-Man down you'll have some great high-attack turns. [Giant-Man](/card/12012) is your best target, and essentially once you draw one of these, you know you're doing at least 10 damage that turn. - [First Aid](/card/01086) is a card you'll use if you just have been unlucky drawing into or recurring your [Inspiring Presence](/card/10030) on [Giant-Man](/card/12012). I use [Goliath](/card/23015) to thwart early and he's also an excellent target. U.S. Agent can take multiple hits with this card as well. Don't forget you can use this in alter-ego form. - [Ready for Action](/card/04017) has been in this deck and I do really love it for this deck with it being a . Especially for U.S. Agent, so you keep blocking the villain. Feel free to sub a card and see how you like it. _________ ### **_Theme!:_** - In the spirit of Quantumania, I've tested this deck extensively, especially with Kang Expert and the MODOK modular with smooth sailing. - So much theme with [Giant-Man](/card/12012), [Goliath](/card/04013), [Stinger](/card/12014), and [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018)! _________ _**I've had a ton of fun with this deck. I love once you're set up, you have a specific tactic in mind and a recursion mechanic I've always been fond of. You can essentially almost recur you're entire deck and pick the card you need for the right situation. Hope you have fun with this deck if you choose to give it a try!**_ _________

name: Powolne ogrywanie S01E06 - Aggression forever!
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S01E06 - Aggression forever! - (karty do Thora)**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

Podobnie jak przy Kapitanie Ameryce z Ironmanem. Deck niby podobny do poprzedniego Thora, ale w praktyce zupełnie inny, jako że T'Challa jest zupełnie inną postacią. Thor miał dużo problemu z zasobami, małą rękę startową, powoli się rozkręcał itp. Czarna pantera jest jego przeciwieństwem - mamy aż 8 podwójnych zasobów dzięki dodatkowym [Vibranium](/card/01044). W dodatku nie mamy takich problemów z schemami dzięki bazowym 2 Thw wspomaganym z [Tactical Genius](/card/01048). No i leczenie z [Vibranium Suit](/card/01049). To wszystko sprawia, że możemy sobie pozwalić na dużo bardziej wolny i kontrolny styl gry niż w przypadku Thora.

- Z nowych zabawek z pakietu Thora mamy przede wszystkim [Mean Swing](/card/06015) i [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019). Mean Swing jest o tyle fajny u Black Panther, że jego dwa upgrade czyli [Panther Claws](/card/01047) i [Energy Daggers](/card/01046) to "weapon" i to takie, których wyczerpywaniem nie musimy się przejmować. Jarnbjorn jest fajne, bo [Wakanda Forever!](/card/01043a) to taki narzędzie do jego aktywacji. Dodatkowo możemy go wyciągnąć z [Shuri](/card/01041). 

- Z naszymi dodatkowymi zasobami możemy być bardziej chciwi jeśli chodzi o ekonomie stąd [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) i [Quincarrier](/card/08023) w decku. Nie są to kluczowe karty, ale jeśli akurat siądą jak mamy podwójne zasoby to swoje jak najbardziej robią. Dodatkowo mamy [Enhanced Physique](/card/19033) jako źródło gwarantowanych piąstek do Jarnbjorna. Tu też uwaga - już w następnym pakiecie z [Black Widow](/card/08001a) dostajemy [Quincarrier](/card/08023), więc jeśli mamy go w swoim arsenale to możemy się pozbyć Enhanced physique. 

- Gramy [Tac Team](/card/01056), który osobiście całkiem lubię (a przynajmniej na tym etapie gry). Nie wyciągamy z niego niesamowitego value - za 3 zasoby łącznie 6 obrażeń rozłożonego na 3 tury jest dalekie do ideału. Podobne value robią sojusznicy za 3 z agresji, a mogą posłużyć jeszcze do obrony ataku i mają często dodatkową zdolność jak grani przez nas [Tigra](/card/01051) czy [Valkyrie](/card/06012). To czemu to gramy? Z kilku powodów. Przede wszystkim mamy dużo podwójnych zasobów, a w momencie gdy już mamy nasze upgrady na stole targetów pod nie mamy mniej, więc możemy sobie pozwolić na cięższe rzeczy. Dwa, że tac team bardzo pasuje do naszej mechaniki, tzn. z naszym [Wakanda Forever!](/card/01043a) mało kiedy potrzebujemy dobić miniona za 5, częsciej raczej potrzebujemy coś tam podobijać więc w jego przypadku preferuje Tac team ponad takie rzeczy jak [Relentless Assault](/card/01053). Trzy fajny jest do kończenia gierek. Zostawiamy sobie 1 zasób na ostatnią turę, wtedy 2x aktywacja tac team, 2 sojuszników z 2 atk  już dmg robi się fajny. Tak czy siak to żaden priorytet na stole, dalej większy mają sojusznicy, Tac team zagrywamy po prostu jak jest okazja.

- Skoro już o sojusznikach mówimy, to gramy ich całkiem sporo.
 - Nick fury - dla mnie "no-brainer" w taliach w których mamy właśnie dużo podwójnych zasobów. Pozwala nam mielić talie, czyli potencjalnie dobrać kolejne [Wakanda Forever!](/card/01043a)
 - [Hulk](/card/01050) - pamiętajcie, że to jednak nie deck Thora gdzie mocno się nastawialiśmy na piąstki. Tu mamy ich znaaacznie mniej. Przez co używanie jego aktywacji jest no... jak wszystko przy Hulku... mocno kontrowersyjne. Hulk jest bardziej do obrony. Jak wejdzie w połączeniu z [The Power of Aggression](/card/01055) to kosztuje tyle co nic, ma 5 hp, więc ma szanse przyjąć na klatę 2 ataku złola.
 - Wspomniany wcześniej duet w postaci [Valkyrie](/card/06012) i [Tigra](/card/01051). Tigra jest szczególnie fajna w tym decku. Z [Wakanda Forever!](/card/01043a) i [Tac Team](/card/01056) setowanie minionów tak by Tigra zadawała im ostatni atak jest bardzo proste, nawet jak miniony mają po te 6 i więcej hp.
 - [Lockjaw](/card/05018) nie jest taki kluczowy jak w poprzednich deckach. Są gry gdzie go nawet nie zagramy, ale zawsze czuwa w pogotowiu na wypadek gdybyśmy potrzebowali te dodatkowe 2 pkt w Sch.
 - [Mockingbird](/card/01083) na tym etapie stalwart jeszcze nie istnieje więc z tego korzystamy. Stuny z czarną panterą są o tyle fajne, że dają nam dodatkowy czas nanadrobienie HPków z [Vibranium Suit](/card/01049). 

- Ostatnimi kartami o których nie mówiliśmy są [Endurance](/card/05023) i [Combat Training](/card/01057). Endurance jest fajne, bo możemy przyjąć dodatkowy hit złola na klatę, a potem spokojnie się leczyć z [Vibranium Suit](/card/01049) gwarantując sobie z niego pełne value. Combat training jest daleko na naszej liście priorytetów. Gramy Mean Swing co prawda, ale to nie jest tak, że będziemy atakować co turę. Kolejna karta która jest ok do zagrania jak podpasują zasoby, ale nie jest niewiadomo jak ważna.

I to by było na tyle. W pilotażu mam wrażenie, że jest ciupkę trudniejszy od reszty omawianych decków, trochę dodatkowych decyzji mamy więcej do podjęcia. Zaczynając od wyboru upgradu na start - przeważnie zaczynam od [Tactical Genius](/card/01048) lub [Vibranium Suit](/card/01049), ale to też nie reguła, zależy mocno od scenariusza. Dodatkowo czy lepiej się zbroić od razu, czy wykorzystać [Wakanda Forever!](/card/01043a) do kontroli stołu na początku kosztem poświęcenia/przesunięcia na później kolejnej części pancerza? Druga rzecz to wykorzystywanie naszego basic power. Atakować potrzebujemy jak mamy [Mean Swing](/card/06015) a to i dodatkowo odpalenie [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019). Sch jest fajny, bo Sch zawsze mało w agresji. Def jest fajny, bo lepiej możemy wykorzystać nasze retaliate. Więc troszkę trzeba jednak wyczuć. Czy warto zagrywać [The Golden City](/card/01045), bo możemy sobie pozwolić na zmianę w Alter-ego, czy jednak czujemy, że w danym scenariuszu to jednak zbyt groźne? Trochę tego jest, ale warto się trochę pomęczyć, bo to naprawdę przyjemny deczek jest.

But my player who will be piloting this deck said they felt a little too vulnerable at times and I wanted to swap out [Blade](/card/21019) for another blocker - using [Daredevil](/card/31014) right now, may look at [Rockslide](/card/33013) if I think the economy could make viable - and using a full suite of [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019).
I think the inspiration deck is sound, I just need to do some customizing for the player in this case.

name: My deck is sooo Smol (Easy way 4 win) 5.0
description_md:
Empecemos con el mazo, se basa en eliminar todas las mejoras, apoyos y aliados de nuestro deck, quedándonos así solo con las 14 cartas de eventos y recursos.
Todo va orientado a poder jugar cartas de manera rápida, los apoyos son en su mayoría para abaratar costes además de permitirnos tener 6 aliados nada menos.
Nuestras mejoras nos ayudaran a reducir aun mas el mazo, y concretamente el casco se convertirá en nuestro motor de supervivencia y robo.
Las 3 cartas de mejora de generación de recurso son intercambiables, pero prefiero llevar una de cada por si sale algún encuentro molesto que me pida recursos específicos para deshacerme de el.
Los aliados son 4 avengers baratos + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12014 , que nos permite tener junto a nuestro aliado de héroe https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12002 los 6 aliados necesarios para el mazo.

Hablemos de juego, nuestra supervivencia se basara en https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12008 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12010 , ya que mientras con el casco ganamos 2 de vida cada vez que somos GIGANTES, podremos meter stuns o confusión a nuestro rival con el brazalete (Por eso llevo solo 2 recursos de los 3 básicos, no me interesa genio, ya que los 2 recursos de ciencia no son útiles para el guantelete).
Intentaremos quedarnos siempre pequeños aunque nos transformemos en GIGANTE(hay que abusar de https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12005 ), para tener un mayor tamaño de mano, aunque podremos recurrir a la forma de alter-ego si no contamos con 2 energías físicas, pero si 2 rayos (Esto es sencillo, para no arriesgarnos a las múltiples cartas de "El villano planifica" que existen en mayor cantidad cuando eres alter-ego).
A la hora de quitar amenazas contaremos con https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12007 para eliminar a los minions molestos, aunque gracias a https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12009 también podremos deshacernos de alguno algo mas grande.
Para la amenaza no suele haber problema, ya que como no recurrimos al alter-ego no sube mucho y ant-man al volverse pequeño quita amenaza, si surge algún plan secundario muy molesto podremos intervenir, e incluso si fuese necesario usar https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12004 (la uso en 1 de cada 5 partidas o menos incluso, y solo 1 vez)

Y llegados a este punto os preguntareis, y todo este rollo, para que nos servirá? Por que queremos 26 cartas en mesa, muchas de ellas poco útiles?(aunque ya os digo que todas son muy útiles) Bueno, cuando nuestro deck+ mano se aproxime a las 14 cartas, alguna mas podemos permitirnos (Creo que llegue a hacerlo con 17) solo tendremos que abusar de https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12005 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12020 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12006 para cambiar de forma infinitamente mientras hacemos daño, quitamos amenaza y aumentamos nuestro daño, además de preparar a nuestro HEROE múltiples veces. con lo que conseguiremos potencial de DAÑO ILIMITADO ganando así a cualquier villano.
Solo debemos de tener cuidado de no dejar nuestra pila de descartes y nuestro mazo vacíos de forma simultanea.

name: Iron Man Desafío Furtivo

name: Ms. Marvel Even the Odds
description_md: # LCG Discord Card Spotlight ## Goal to build a deck that features the current spotlit card: [Even the Odds](/card/30014) Oh it hit's multiple side schemes... Oh [Shrink](/card/05011) pumps [Even the Odds](/card/30014)... Oh [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) can recur it to hand every turn if needed. This is NOT a solo deck. You will depend on teammates to maintain the board while you build up to the combo turn. ## GAME PLAN: ### [One Way or Another](/card/22015) We recur this as much as we are comfortable to build up a big board of Side Schemes, while using the draw to get out [Overwatch](/card/30019), [Followed](/card/03032), [Sense of Justice](/card/14030), [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009), & most importantly [Shrink](/card/05011) ### [Even the Odds](/card/30014) and to a lesser extent [Multitasking](/card/15013) to soften up the side schemes. Use [Passion for Justice](/card/34020) & [Shrink](/card/05011) to make big Thwarts. Trigger a bunch of upgrades. ### When to go off? I'd wait for 3 side schemes and to have [Followed](/card/03032) and [Overwatch](/card/30019) on all three. You will trigger for 3 x 4 damage ([Followed](/card/03032)) and 3 damage ([Even the Odds](/card/30014)). Overwatch is variable but these will help you get the Main Scheme down if you had any issues due to Patrol or Crisis Icons. You can certainly go off with more than 3 but, I would want to keep Side Schemes in for rebuilding to do it again. RULES NOTE: Sadly [Embiggen!](/card/05010) doesn't work with [Even the Odds](/card/30014). ### Allies [Wasp](/card/29034) is the the mainly there because of Crisis Icons that are likely to be on Side Schemes. [Jessica Jones](/card/01059) is there to keep the main under control with buffs from the side schemes we're leaving out. [Quake](/card/08012) is cheap and an . [Quasar](/card/21047) can help you set-up for the big turn. ### FLEXIBLE SPOTS: [One Way or Another](/card/22015) #3 - With [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) being above to recur the event, you should only ever need one. However, you want to get the 1st as soon as possible. ### ALTERNATE CONSIDERATIONS: [Spider-Man](/card/04045) - We aren't looking to clear side schemes early but there are some scenarios with huge side schemes where I'd consider him. He also costs 5 in a deck that only has the basic resources to assist in paying for him [Eros](/card/22011) - Is cheap with a decent THW. If you need to defend more then this is good for that. [Wraith](/card/22012) - I love Wraith as tech against annoying boosts. Doesn't fit the theme but worth a consider. [Even the Odds](/card/30014) #3 - You really don't need a full 3 of this card with all of the card draw off of [One Way or Another](/card/22015) and the potential to stash them with [Bruno Carrelli](/card/05007). [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) - It is not quite the engine it is in other decks since we want to clear multiple schemes in one turn instead of 1 per turn. More [Operative Skill](/card/37013) - May be worth running more but you can only have 1 in play at a time and you should get to it when you're running [One Way or Another](/card/22015) every turn.

name: Theoretically Infinite
description_md:
One of my friends and I love to theory craft and we got to thinking about if or how it is possible to have an infinite turn in marvel champions. Here is one of them. I'd like to note that none of these decks are practical. At the very least, the villain is very likely going to be defeated before you get to the point where you have everything set up to have an infinite turn. Anyway, here's how to go infinite with [Doctor Strange](/card/09001a):

1. Get EVERY "permanent" into play. "Permanent" as in all allies, supports, and upgrades.

2. Draw 6 cards for your turn.

3. Draw another with [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091).

4. Play [Master of the Mystic Arts](/card/09005) with [Helicarrier](/card/01092) on [Winds of Watoomb](/card/09036) to draw 3.

5. Repeat step 4 with [Quincarrier](/card/08023).

6. Use Dr. Strange's hero ability to draw another 3. 

7. So at this point we have 6 + 1 + 3 + 3 + 3 = 16 cards in our hand out of 16 cards in our deck (13 events and 3 resources). At this point (and there are other ways to get here too, like using [Cosmo](/card/17020)/[Wong](/card/09002) + [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) draw more) you can infinitely spam [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019). In this example, having an infinite turn doesn't actually produce and damage or threat removal BUT it is an infinite turn nonetheless.

name: Infinite Turn with Spectrum
description_md:
A not-at-all practical but nonetheless possible way to have an infinite turn with [Spectrum](/card/21001a): 

1. Get every single ally, support, and upgrade on the field.

2. Draw 6 for alter-ego hand size. (6/17 cards in hand)

3. Draw 1 using [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091). (7/17 cards in hand)

4. Draw 6 using [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). (12/17 cards in hand)

5. Activate 3x [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) to [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) again for 3. (14/17 cards in hand. At this point, you can infinitely cycle [Speed of Light](/card/21010) to generate 1 damage/threat/heal indefinitely.

Edit: Technically, you need a teammate to let you draw another card but for solo, just remove a resource card and add another permanent.

name: Behind Enemy Lines: Venom Confuse Lock
description_md:
Full write-up soon. 

The short of it all, is that the deck is built around trying to Confuse the Villain as much as possible to keep allowing [Scare Tactic](/card/20012) and [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015) to deal damage as well as taking advantage of free turns for yourself or another Hero to flip down to Alter-Ego safely for a turn to Recover, draw extra cards, use abilities, etc. 

Deck is a great control deck that is able to remove threat, deal damage, and even defend reliably. this allows this build to be useful in solo as well as a great fill in option for multiplayer. Venom is a very powerful hero with a great well-rounded kit and resource generator on himself to help utilize cards with cost specifications such as [Behind Enemy Lines](/card/20002), [Savage Attack](/card/20006), [Grasping Tendrils](/card/20003), [Eros](/card/22011), [For Justice!](/card/01060), and [Concussive Blow](/card/05031).

name: (Mazo erróneo)
description_md:
Al empezar tu turno sigue estos pasos:
1. Calcula si derrotas al villano este turno.
  -> Si no lo derrotas este turno, construye mesa.
  -> Si sí lo derrotas este turno, hazlo.
2. No hay más pasos.

El problema de Hulk
Hulk su problema es que no tiene sinergia alguna. Por no tener, no tiene una habilidad que le beneficie y su alto Atq y Def ya están equilibrados con el comeback de tener Int 0.

Asi que lo único explotable son los altos stats de Atq y Def. Y dado que al no poder intervenir la partida se convierte en una carrera a contrarreloj no puede basar su estrategia en defender.

Eso nos deja con 2 estrategias posibles: utilizar Justicia para compensar su Intervenir o Agresividad. Este mazo ha optado por la más coherente con la imagen de Hulk (aunque Justicia sea una idea mucho más viable).

Solución: Cómo aprovechamos este alto Atq, pues centrando la estrategia en preparar a nuestro Hulk. Ya sea mediante Tenacidad, Aguante ilimitado o Fuerza imparable deberíamos poder preparar a Hulk al menos 3 veces con una "buena" mano.
La idea es que cuando llegue esa mano, tengamos el Atq de Hulk en 4 o 5 por Entrenamiento de combate y Furia desatada además de 2 o 3 Descargas de adrenalina.
En dicho turno se usan todas las descargas de adrenalina lo que nos deja un Hulk con 6, 7 u 8 de Atq.
Ejemplo: Un Hulk de 7 de atq que puede prepararse 3 veces va a poder hacer 7+7+7+7=28 puntos de daño.
Esta explosión de daño en un turno genera una sinergia con Hulk puesto que es muy susceptible al control del villano, nos da una posibilidad de acabar la partida sin que el villano llegue a jugar su 2ª fase.

name: Pacifist Vision (Combo Deck)
description_md:
I participated in a challenge recently to make a deck using [Even the Odds](/card/30014) which seems like a really fun card but often isn't worth the payoff. Enter the Vision - where we can make a unique deck with justice cards that wins but **NEVER ATTACKS**.

**The Mission:** Use Vision's [Intangible](/card/26002) form to ignore minions and mot villain attacks while you focus on what Justice does best  - thwarting! You'll be setting up a big combo and using all sources of non attack damage we can find in justice and basic cards.

**The Set-Up:** On your first deckpass you need to focus on setting up your big game winning combo. 
- Hack into the villains deck with [One Way or Another](/card/22015) to get 3 + side schemes into play. 
- Leave some malware for the villain with upgrades that boost the defeat of these side schemes like [Followed](/card/03032), [Chance Encounter](/card/26034), and [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047).
- Line up the defeat using allies to set-up side scheme wipe-out with [Even the Odds](/card/30014)

**The Combo:**
- Play [Even the Odds](/card/30014) to defeat 3+ side schemes and take all your damage to the villains face.
- 3 damage from even the odds
- 12 damage from 3 copies of [Followed](/card/03032)

**Card Choices:** Every card in this deck is here to help us complete the mission.
- We have a plethora of damage dealing non-attack allies - [Daredevil](/card/01058), [Jack Flag](/card/20011), [Wiccan](/card/15011) and even [Quake](/card/08012)
- We can use [Just Passing Through](/card/26010) to get around crisis side schemes in a pinch.
- [Reboot](/card/26024) is here to ready and reuse vision while healing any damage they take through [Intangible](/card/26002) form
- And don't forget [Command Center](/card/35032) which can be used when allies clean up problematic side schemes

I hope you have fun with this combo deck and taking out the villain in a unique new way.

name: Wasp - That Stings! (Combo Deck)
description_md:
Hey all! We are in a new renaissance of marvel champions deck-building with... [Wasp](/card/13001c). I participated in a challenge recently to make a deck using [Even the Odds](/card/30014) which seems like a really fun card but often isn't worth the payoff.

Enter the Wasp. 

**The Mission:** Use Wasp's *Small But Mighty* ability to tee up extra villain damage. See if you can take down the villain without attacking using some justice shenanigans. If you like this deck you can also check out the [Vision](/card/26001b) variant (https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/26874/pacifist-vision-combo-deck-1.0).

**The Set-Up:** On your first deckpass you need to focus on setting up your big game winning combo. 
- Hack into the villains deck with [One Way or Another](/card/22015) to get 3 + side schemes into play. 
- Leave some malware for the villain with upgrades that boost the defeat of these side schemes like [Followed](/card/03032), [Chance Encounter](/card/26034), and [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047).
- Line up the defeat of these side schemes using Wasp's Giant Form - spreading thwart around to set them up all to defeat at once.

**The Combo:**
- Play [Even the Odds](/card/30014) to defeat 3+ side schemes and sting the villain with your small pings add up to 18+ damage!
- 3 damage from even the odds
- 3 damage from Small but mighty
- 12 damage from 3 copies of [Followed](/card/03032)
- Plus you can go and find 3 allies and a card draw from [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047)!

**Card Choices:** Every card in this deck is here to help us complete the mission.
- [Vivian](/card/26003) can blank problematic side schemes and be recurred into you deck in a pinch.
- [Jack Flag](/card/20011) and [Wiccan](/card/15011) provide more non-attack damage to throw at the villain.
- [Quasar](/card/21047) can help set up your combo while [Jessica Jones](/card/01059) can hold down the main scheme while you leave those pesky side schemes in the way.
- I choose to include one copy of [Operative Skill](/card/37013) and one copy of [Overwatch](/card/30019) but you could up yourself to 2x [Operative Skill](/card/37013) to boost your even the odds.

I hope you have fun with this combo deck and set-up a killer trap for the villain!

name: How to Thwart Like a Boss: The Ultimate Spider-Man Justice G
description_md:
**>Create a Marvel Champions: The Card Game deck that will receive the most Likes on marvelcdb.com.**

Searching for: Marvel Champions: The Card Game

Searching for: marvelcdb.com

Generating answers for you…

Sure, I can try to create a Marvel Champions: The Card Game deck that will receive the most Likes on marvelcdb.com. Based on the search results, Marvel Champions: The Card Game is a cooperative, living card game published by Fantasy Flight Games. Players control decks representing heroes from the Marvel Universe, and work together to defeat a villain that is attempting to complete a "Scheme". Marvelcdb.com is a website that provides a fast, powerful and exhaustive deck builder and search engine for Marvel Champions cards, along with card descriptions and card images.

One possible deck that I created is:

Hero: Spider-Man Aspect: Justice Cards:

15 Spider-Man cards
15 Justice cards
10 Basic cards

Description: This deck is designed to use Spider-Man’s high Thwarting ability and Justice cards to prevent the villain from advancing their scheme. Spider-Man can also deal decent damage with his Web-Shooters and Backflip. The Basic cards provide some card draw, healing and resource generation.

Strategy:
- Use Spider-Man’s ability to draw a card whenever the villain initiates an attack against you.

- Use Web-Shooters to generate Wild resources for your Justice cards.

- Use Backflip to avoid taking damage from the villain’s attack.

- Use For Justice!, Clear the Area and Counterintelligence to remove threat from the main scheme and side schemes.

- Use Interrogation Room and Under Surveillance to slow down the villain’s scheme progress.

- Use Concussive Blow, Spider-Tracer and Webbed Up to stun, confuse and immobilize the villain.

- Use Enhanced Spider-Sense, Great Responsibility and The Power of Justice to cancel or reduce encounter cards effects.

- Use Aunt May, First Aid and Med Team to heal yourself or your allies.

- Use Avengers Mansion, Helicarrier and Quincarrier to draw more cards and reduce the cost of your cards.

name: Rocket Raccoon and his Angry Friends
description_md:
This is the Rocket Racoon Deck I used to run in Aggression in my solo expert league.  Its the only aggression deck I ever retired to my Hall of Fame even though the results are ok.

I have always had trouble with aggression build pre-Nova so I suspect once I get 40+ plays in Nova will be next aggression retiree.

W-L record 16-24 (40% win rate).
------------------------------------------------

Highlight wins....
------------------------------------------------
Collector B (Band of Badoon)
Collector B (Hydra Assault)
Thanos (Enchantress)
Venom (Down to Earth)

Primary Play Strategy
-------------------------------------
Rocket is good at thwarting and has solid Hero Kit Upgrades.
He needs help in sustainability which favors a lean into cheaper allies.
Note here that Wasp is a light lean-in-and -defend for 1 resource
The Power in All of Us package help[s out a good bit.
The rest of the kit are situational Aggression events that are more often used as resources,

Challenges
-------------------------------------
Top Tier Villains (Ronin, Venom Goblin, Collector A, Loki, Nebula, and Zola all swept Rocket) 
Overkill villains can be a big problem (as is Collector A).
Villains that over-spam threat as aggression has a hard time keeping pace (eg. Loki).

name: The Pilot's Seat
description_md:
This is my first time publishing a deck, so don't go too hard on me. I don't even know how to link the cards in the text here. :-) 

When I bought SP//dr, the level of apparent complication in the deck really called to me as something that could be a really great engine to build on, but she had what I call the Hawkeye problem; the identity deck doesn't really lean into one aspect more than the others. I just wanted a general deck that made her... better at the things she was already doing. 

Then along came All Systems Go All Out.

I cannot give the original author enough credit for this deck, which is pretty obviously just a stripped down and edited version of that deck. There were a lot of Web Warrior and Spider-Verse cards in it that, on my playthroughs, seemed to get in the way of the heart of what the deck was trying to accomplish. The idea was to boost yourself up a lot, throw out a [Go All Out](/card/29017) or [Push Ahead](/card/29018), then re-ready and exhaust whichever Interface card was appropriate for easy double-digit thwart or damage in one turn, on top of whatever you were doing with your other cards.

I feel like any kind of tactical walkthrough would just be a beginner's course in how to play SP//dr; hard mulligan for [All Systems Go!](/card/31004), [Host Spider](/card/31010) or [Aunt May & Uncle Ben](/card/31007), then build the resource and boost engine as fast as possible for big swings and killer plays. Throw Ven#m out when you can boost her to being a 5 Att and 5 Thwart for no additional cards from your hand. As always, SP//dr fears no kicker as she can generate most whatever resource she needs to at any given time with her Pilot Interface. And obviously if things get too hairy, she has the unique ability to attack or thwart (twice, even) in the same round that she recovers because of her split identity card.

It's a great deck. The only things I'm not 100% satisfied with are First Aid and Target Acquired; these are situationally very useful in a pinch to either get some extra pinch healing or cancel a terrible boost card, respectively, but the former comes up rarely with her built in recovery and may be better served with something like one copy of Downtime. And honestly the most fun element to me is that when the board is all set up and I'm rotating cards and sliding things around and playing them, it feels like I'm manipulating the controls of a mecha (dials, levers and buttons, respectively).

But yeah. I've had an incredible success rate with her and wanted to share the joy. Let me know what you think, and especially if you have suggestions to replace First Aid and Target Acquired with something else.

name: Wolverine & The X-Men with SHIELD Tactical Support
description_md:
I'm a new player to the game and now that I've had some time to get myself familiar with the cards I wanted to see what people thought of one of my first deck builds.

When I started to feel comfortable enough with the cards to start building my own decks I was really motivated to put them together in a way that would represent something I would like to see in the actual comics.  When I picked up the Wolverine hero pack, I thought how cool would it be to see a story with Wolverine leading a group of X-Men backed up by Nick Fury and some SHIELD Tactical teams.  

I feel this deck has a good mix of resources to be able to put cards into play, as well as several different avenues to attack and thwart (Wolverine upgrades and attacks, X-Men allies, and backed up by Nick Fury with SHIELD assets (Mockingbird and several tactical teams).

I've tried it out and it's a pretty good deck so far.  I am open to any suggestions to improve it.  Thanks.

name: Colossus Calling All X-Men!
description_md:
# **COLOSSUS**

## SCL S14/R2

This deck was created for round 2 of Season 14 for Solo Campions League. The scenario was Standard 2 Risky Business, with The Wrecking Crew Modular encounter set from The Hood scenario pack. It did not disappoint.

### HOW IT WORKS
 The key to the deck is getting it built during the first pass. You’re looking for [Iron Will](/card/32004), [Moira MacTaggert](/card/38018), and [Danger Room](/card/33021). While building out, you play the ally’s as you can over your attack cards to be able to handle the thwarting and take down minions. 

Flip to alter-ego often, almost every turn, so you can get the benefits of doing so. 

Playing this deck I went through the scenario taking 0 damage, clearing all threat, and defeating the villain in 6/7/10 turns. 

Colossus is a beast!

name: X-Men, Dancing with the Star(Lord)s
description_md:
This show only lasted one season.

Hello everyone! Star-Lord has made a real 180 in interest for me over the past year. I think having other teams/tribals enter the game has just made him more interesting, sharing his Gaurdian trait easily with teams that bring their own strengths. This deck aims to reliably setup some of the best thwarting allies in the game, fielding a team of X-Men Allies with Mission Training and a board wide boost from Leader of the Gaurdians.

The Stars

We're using a suite of effective allies that we actively want to play with with What Could Go Wrong?, and get the most out of our buffing effects. Banshee can give us an added bonus when he thwarts, Blindfolds affect works well with Star-Lord in particular, Dazzler gives a valuable confuse on play, and Marvel Girl has the best Thwart:Health:Cost ratio for our X-Men allies, with a situationally positive affect. We won't be buffing Professor-X but his three Thwart+Confuse+Chump block is too much to not include, with some additional utility that's nice to have in the back pocket. Mockingbird and Gamora are also just super valuable to bring out with our ability and are some of the best Tempo and Value allies respectively for their cost.

The Show

The premise is Simple, Leader of the Gaurdians and a Mission Training can setup an ally to singlehandedly manage a whole players worth of threat by themselves for several turns. Blindfold is our worst target for this and even she will manage 16 Threat by herself when things are said and done. Danger Room will let us get this set-up consistently and make repeating it effortless. X-Mansion can also keep spinning value out of an ally if we wish to focus on developing something else. We're bringing Sonic Rifles(carried in a side holster), as we'll have an easier time playing them than most other heroes and they'll let us flip down to utilize our powerful supports more. This will also enable Meditation. We like this a lot more than Power of Justice or Basic, since it can hit targets for both of those as well has our hero specific cards. The alter-ego restriction is not an issue since we're doing it anyway to use our supports and have ample confuse, plus we're not reliant on our basic activation to progress our gameplan. Our ample Thwarting also makes cards like One Way or Another and Command Center much more accessible and easier, and are nice rewards for doing our jobs well.

The Script

One of the great things about this list is the small amount of setup you need. We really just want to hard mulligan for Leader of the Guardians and Danger Room. Danger Room becomes less of a priority the more aggressive you expect the villain's early game to be, as we'll possibly want to chump block before setup is completed. We can always hard play Training upgrades on our allies, but Danger Room does represent value and consistency that should not be overlooked. Also, we want to make sure we setup at least one Element Gun from our opener. 5-damage (2 from our activation and 3 from a gun) is going to be enough to handle most damage demands until we reach setup, especially if we give ourselves an extra turn for damage from a Banshee activation confusing a minion. Command Center also helps solve these problems cleanly, but since it's dependent on actually having a side scheme in play for our stellar allies to defeat, we don't want to miss out on guaranteed damage. Post-setup, we are not going to have much issue getting into alter-ego to quickly equip an X-Men ally. Playing an ally in Alter-Ego may seem awkward, but we have so much Thwart that we won't miss anything dropped there. We're also just as likely to start in AE so getting the full boost from the get go is very feasible.

The Side-Deck

Overwatch might seem like a obvious include here, but our Thwart is just high enough that it generally isn't necessary even in a two-player game. For going up in player count or playing against a Villian which starts with more Threat/side-schemes I think you can justify it. Game Time falls under a very similar umbrella. We are already Thwarting enough, but if we notice more burst Thwarting is needed it might be wanted. Think Fast! is also a very potent card, though I didn't like how it could conflict with the on play affects of allies we wanted to hit the table, so that's why the Sonic Rifles were brought in as a more on-demand option. If you're in a fast paced solo game or with a team where no one else is confusing then you can find room for it. Best of luck, and I hope anyone who plays this list enjoys!

name: Beaches love Spider-Man
description_md:
Hi everyone, this is your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man speaking and I'll be your lifeguard today. Allow me to give you an overview of the beaches we're coasting on by today, followed with some general ideas on how to be a lifeguard on these beaches.

The Beaches

The Black Cat Beach
What a fine beach, one of the originals. You're always going to be happy to see this one. Hope the mere sight of her has you [Inspired](/card/01074), because villains (and their minions) beware when you put your [Leadership Skill](/card/36019) to the test on this one. You also might find yourself suddenly in possession of a [Med Lab](/card/38028) or [Quincarrier](/card/08023) or some other goodies. Just...don't ask where the funding comes from.
The Ghost-Spider Beach
Access to this beach can be restricted unless you got your [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) ticket at the ready or own yourself a nice [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023). Let's be real though, you have to be ready to [Make the Call](/card/01071) to access this beach and that's fine because once there, you will soon be pulling your [Backflip](/card/01003)s, [Swinging Web Kick](/card/01005)s and that [Enhanced Spider-Sense](/card/01004) will definitely be up for some tingling too.
The Ironheart Beach
This beach is pretty straightforward. Sometimes gets found by the [Black Cat](/card/01002) beach, which is good. It's a solid beach that provides you with all the things you want from a beach: easy to access, able to provide you with more resources and you're never going to be unhappy to just run this beach out.
The Maria Hill Beach
If you wanna throw a party, this is where to do it. Everyone will be happy to see this beach. For some reason, this beach seems to always be in need of some kind of [Rapid Response](/card/08031), but that's alright because if you pull that one off, this will make everyone happy! Same if you decide to [Make the Call](/card/01071) for this beach.
The Mockingbird Beach
Ah, a classic. Not great for those pesky steady and stalwart types, but you're likely to get some enjoyment out of this stunning beach. Given its healthy rating, it's a great beach to feel [Inspired](/card/01074) by. Just don't tell Nick Fury we're borrowing this beach.
The SP//dr Beach
Like the Ghost-Spider beach, this beach might initially be restricted in access. Once you've got access though, the recurring nature of this beach gets you quite a bit of mileage and you will absolutely love this beach once you got yourself that [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023).
The Stinger Beach
This beach is tiny. So tiny, you won't even notice the beach is there! That being said, this beach benefits from a display of your [Leadership Skill](/card/36019). Despite it's small size, this beach gives you the breathing room you need at times to get that well earned R&R.
The White Tiger Beach
The nastier the villains get, the better this beach becomes! Early on, this beach almost pays for itself and in the later stages, you're just really happy to see this beach. Doesn't do well with [Rapid Response](/card/08031)s or when you [Make the Call](/card/01071), but that's alright as we've got our [Med Lab](/card/38028) specifically for this beach.

Spidey's Lifeguard Class 101

We've got several tools to make good use of our beaches. First and foremost, let's highlight our [Med Lab](/card/38028). As mentioned before, The White Tiger beach makes excellent use of this facility. Combined with being somewhat of a scientist myself, [Ingenuity](/card/29027), our handy dandy [Web-Shooter](/card/01008)s and the [Quincarrier](/card/08023), every time we have some down time while we access the [Med Lab](/card/38028), we're going to have a great time keeping our beaches fresh like an ocean breeze. We really hope to get to see that great [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) once we've officially become a [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029), but it if we have the resources to spare and have not visited the [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048) beach or the [SP//dr](/card/30021) beach yet, we may want to consider it because of how good it will be. Being able to [Rapid Response](/card/08031) any of the beaches is going to be good, but I doubt you needed me to tell you that. [Leadership Skill](/card/36019) is really good, because you can spread its use out across the beaches when and where you need to. Unfortunately, you can have only one display of your [Leadership Skill](/card/36019)s out, but it works in tandem with that [Inspired](/card/01074) [Black Cat](/card/01002) beach. Finally, it's good to remember that it's not the lifeguard's duty to protect the beach, but to make sure no one drowns in the sea of villainy. ___________________________________________________ Hope you enjoyed reading this! The idea of "'Beaches' love Spider-Man" came to me and I felt like I had to make a deck that revolves around that. It's honestly not an amazing/spectacular deck as is, but sometimes it's good to remember that building things around a theme and having fun with it is just as important as trying to come up with the most effective strategies. Leadership Spidey works pretty damn well in general, as Spider-Sense triggers before you declare an ally as a potential blocker. [Rapid Response](/card/08031) and [Make the Call](/card/01071) having a printed resource means [Black Cat](/card/01002) can draw you into them as well, which is just awesome.

name: [LMDT] Brigada Romanoff - S.H.I.E.LD. pero no mucho - BGF
description_md:
Muy buenas a todos!! Pues aquí probando otro de los mazos candidatos a llevarme a Board Game Fest. Y en este caso he querido tirar de una Viuda con arquetipo S.H.I.E.L.D pero versión lite. En sus primeras iteraciones era una versión completa del arquetipo con ella, pero me di cuenta que en ciertos escenarios exigentes de amenaza, montar toda la maquinaria S.H.I.E.L.D supone un tiempo que no siempre te puedes permitir perder. Por eso en este mazo he intentado mantener la esencia pero siendo un poco más proactivos quitando amenaza.

Si nos centramos en las cartas S.H.I.E.L.D, podemos ver que los objetivos _factibles_ para [Intervención de S.H.I.E.L.D.](/card/27042) son las tres copias de [Equipo de vigilancia](/card/01064), las 2 de [Agente sobre el terreno](/card/27044), y los aliados con 1 de intervención, que en este caso son [Temblor](/card/08012) y [Monica Chang](/card/27040), que es al final la que te busca los Equipo de vigilancia. Si te encuentras en héroe varios turnos seguidos (que suele ser raro con este tipo de mazos), [Piso franco n.º 29](/card/08005) puede ser objetivo válido para intervenir. La propia Viuda en alter ego, si no necesitamos curarnos, también puede sacarnos de un aprieto. En casos muy desesperado y solo si tienes a [Agente 13](/card/03002) o literalmente nada más que hacer con él, el [Helitransporte](/card/01092) también es válido. Por tanto tenemos 7 objetivos preferentes, 2 situacionales y 1 de emergencias. 

Entonces, al tener menos objetivos para intervenir con [Intervención de S.H.I.E.L.D.](/card/27042), necesitamos paliar un poco la amenaza por otro lado, que puede ser suficiente o no dependiendo del escenario. De las cartas que han venido con Gambito, [Breaking and Entering](/card/37015) y [Operative Skill](/card/37013) pueden darnos ese extra de quitar amenaza, ya que ambos pueden usarse en alter ego y habrá que priorizar más que en otros mazos [Operación encubierta](/card/08003).

He estado dudando sobre que preparaciones meter y al final me he decidido por [Contraespionaje](/card/08017), para cubrir aún más el tema de la amenaza; y [Tácticas de infiltración](/card/08018) para control de cartas de encuentro. Ambas son Interrupción, a diferencia de [Objetivo fijado](/card/08024) que había metido inicialmente,que es Respuesta **de héroe**, lo que facilita su uso aunque no se active la pasiva de Viuda Negra. El número de copias de ambas cartas varíara dependiendo de la exigencia del escenario en quitar amenaza (3-1) o evitar cartas de encuentro (2-2 o 1-3). 

Respecto a los recursos, creo que funciona bien tal como está pero se podría discutir si quitar una copia de [El poder de todos unidos](/card/13024) por una copia de [El poder de la justicia](/card/01062) o incluso quitarla simplemente. Todo esto depende de que cartas termines dandole más uso, aunque si que es verdad que creo que hay mucha más carta de Justicia que entra y sale constantemente que de las básicas, lo que le va a dar más salida al recurso de aspecto. 

Problema principal de este mazo (y la Viuda Justicia en general) y razón por la que creo que funciona mejor a multi: Es un mazo bastante egoísta y tienes carencias grandisimas en cuanto a infligir daño a los enemigos. Dependes mucho de activar con frecuencia tus preparaciones en héroe y tus tres unicas copias de ataque, así como los aliados. Me he enfretado a Mojo con él y he ganado con las justas (en Normal, como persona decente que soy), usando a Agente 13 para atacar de 1 en varios casos. En escenarios con más planes secundarios, se puede plantear meter el [Centro de mando](/card/35032) o [Seguimiento](/card/03032), pero creo que definitivamente no es un mazo de meterte en escenarios con mucho esbirro o que no tengas a alguien con Agresivdad cubriendote el daño.

Bueno, ya teneis aquí otra opinión de alguien que no tiene demasiada idea, pero le gusta hablarlo mucho. ¡Un saludo y mover ficha para todos! (Aunque a Viuda le de un poco más igual...)

name: [LMDT] Gambito defensa total
description_md:
Mazo que controla muy bien los ataques del villano en solo y que gestiona con cierta solvencia la amenaza. 

De cara a controlar el daño:
- Es clave que no reciba daño defendiendo para activar la mayoría de sus mejoras.
- Su carta propia de defensa, los contadores de la carta de Judo y el aumento de defensa de "Not Today!" son sus armas principales para lograrlo.
- El duro que da Polaris también puede ser clave como salvavidas.
- A mesa montada si logras defender sin recibir daño quitas 3 de amenaza de plan principal, haces 3 de daño al enemigo, te preparas y robas carta, a lo que se puede sumar otros 2 de amenaza a cualquier plan.

De cara a controlar amenaza:
- Con los "Difícil de ignorar" gestionas la subida del plan principal.
- Los "Not today!" controlan cualquier plan.
- Con Xavier y Pícara puedes bajar bastante amenaza.
- La habilidad de Remy + Gremio si se cuadra bien es muy potente, sobre todo junto a "Encanto criollo" y lograr confundir al Villano, ya sea con esta carta o Xavier. Además la habilidad de Remy te permite controlar el siguiente turno del Villano.

El resto de aliados te ayudan en general en lo que necesites y son un buen parapeto si hacen falta, además que te permiten prepararte con Utopía.

Por último, todo esto va limando al Villano pero lo normal es rematarle con los eventos propios de Gambito de ataque que además con muy versátiles para controlar esbirros en mesa.

name: Ghost Spider defensora (MagicFest) [LMDT]
description_md: Mazo de defensa total, en el que dejaremos en mesa permanentemente a Spider-Uk (haciendo 5 de daño y eliminando a los esbirros cuando defienda, y preparándolo con el Hangar para hacerlo 2 veces cada fase de villano) y Spiderman Noir (quitando de circulación las 3 perfidias que vemos más incordiosas). Seda y Spiderman Octavius se irán alternando, porque lo que nos interesa son sus capacidades al entrar en juego. Y SP/dr será un aliado recursivo mientras nos salen Octavius y Seda. Con las capacidades de preparación que tiene GhostSpider, junto a los eventos de defensa y los aliados, podremos defender 3 y 4 ataques por fase de villano.

name: ¿Me estás pegando? (MagicFest) [LMDT]
description_md: Mazo de defensa total, con el que podremos defender tranquilamente 3 ataques por turno, robando cartas por descartar duros y preparándonos con las defensas desesperadas, el indómito y los Aguantes ilimitados. Además, como siempre defenderemos con duro, no recibiremos daño y por tanto todas las capacidades "después de defender y no recibir daño" se dispararán. Con Protectores Mutantes podremos poner aliados a defender y así darnos un respiro. Es un mazo muy enfocado a Multi, en el que necesitaremos que alguien nos apoye con Justicia porque no quita amenaza.

name: SCL 1402 - Teamwork Rework
description_md:
This is for Solo Champions League - Season 14, Round 2

* Risky Business + Wrecking Crew (03/05/23-3/18/23)
* Difficulty: Standard II
* Hero: 
  - Champions: Ironheart, Nova, or Ms. Marvel
  - Guardians: Gamora, Nebula, or Star-Lord
  - Web-Warriors: Ghost-Spider, SP//dr, or Spider-Ham
  - X-Men: Colossus, Cyclops, or Storm
* Aspect: Leadership
* Deck-Building Constraints:  No cards with "Avenger" trait.  At least 3 cards with or requiring your faction trait.

Finished in 5, 7 and 5 turns with a [Dark Dealings](/card/24050) that took me to 6 threat on the main scheme in the first game (one of those times that [Total Annihilation](/card/24054) is a welcome boost card), clean boards and above maximum health. Double [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044) for the win in game 3.

I built the deck around building out the board for the first few turns, flipping frequently, and having a lot of ways to keep the hero + ally health high for the end game. 

The deck was initially inspired by [NormalModeGuy](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24390/storm-leader-of-the-x-men-v2-0-2.0)'s deck with 3x [Teamwork](/card/06032), but I later realized that this card's primary purpose was saving one or two consequential damage for one effective resource and some restrictions, and I had far better ways to keep my team health up than this, hence "Teamwork Rework"

* With Steady from the Standard II set being out [Professor X](/card/32019) and [Mirage](/card/36015) were there as last resorts if I needed synergistic allies and I played each of them once across the three games.
* [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) did not pay off once (cycled it for a card a couple of times)
* [Mutant Education](/card/37021) was a great way to get [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044) back into the deck, with [Blast of Wind](/card/36013) being next best. 
* This round made [Blast of Wind](/card/36013) go up in my estimation quite a bit as I seemed to frequently have a minion out so being able to do 6 spread out damage and activate a special was reasonably efficient. 
* All games finished before I had to draw an encounter card from decking out.

name: Counter-cat!
description_md:
Shadowcat is a very strong defensive hero thanks to her Mass form. To get the most out of her kit, you want to be able to manipulate her forms efficiently and that makes her a fun hero to play! Generally try to always end Hero phase in Phased form. The easiest way to do this is to plan your attacks and flip to Phased after the last attack you play *(note that flipping to Solid is forced but flipping to Phased is not)*. 

Another important mechanic to know is playing a defense event lets you "get aggro" (be the attack target) when the enemy is attacking another player. This lets you defend for another player even after you're exhausted.

#### **Combos**
 1. *Basic defense (P>S) > [Counter-Punch](/card/01077) (S>P)*: defend against 1 attack and puts you back to Phased. Useful to continue defending or setup [Airwalk](/card/32039)/[Phase Strike](/card/32038).
 2. *[Defiance](/card/26018)/[Jump Flip](/card/27014) (P>S) > [Counter-Punch](/card/01077) (S>P)*: same as #1 if you're the 1st attack target while letting you be ready to use basic defense/thwart/attack.
 3. *#1 > [Quick Shift](/card/32040)/[Preemptive Strike](/card/05014) (P>S)*:  defend against 2nd attack.
 4. *#1 > [Defiance](/card/26018)/[Jump Flip](/card/27014) (P>S)*: defend against 2nd attack if you're the attack target.
 5. *#1 > [Ready to Rumble](/card/32051)*: gives versatility in the follow-up since you can defend against 2nd attack or basic thwart while Phased for [Intangible Interference](/card/32035).
 6. *Basic defense (P>S) > [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) (S>P>S)*: defend against 2 attacks. Since [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) is both an attack and defense, playing it while Solid will flip you to Phased (b/c you attacked) and get aggro (b/c you also defended). While defending, the flip back to Solid is delayed until after the attack is over.
 7. *Basic defense (P>S) > [Quick Shift](/card/32040) (S>P>S)*: defend against 2 attacks. [Quick Shift](/card/32040) will flip you back to Phased (card effect) and get aggro (b/c you also defended). Then you'd flip back to Solid after the attack is over.
 8. *[Quick Shift](/card/32040) (P>S) > [Counter-Punch](/card/01077) (S>P) > basic defense (P>S)*: draw 2 cards while defending against 2 attacks.

#### **Card Choices**

 * [Counter-Punch](/card/01077): lets you flip back to Phased after defending.
 * [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014): lets you defend any player without using a basic defense but has a risk of not being playable if there's 0 boost icon revealed. 
 * [Defiance](/card/26018): lets you defend when you're getting attacked without using a basic defense.
 * [Jump Flip](/card/27014): like [Defiance](/card/26018) and also lets you trigger [Intangible Interference](/card/32035) as you'll be Phased when it resolves.
 * [Powerful Punch](/card/32014): lets you change form and defend with just one card. You want to play this when you're Solid and since this is the case, you can use Solid to pay for its cost.
 * [Jocasta](/card/26013): 4 thwart and gets back your [Powerful Punch](/card/32014)/[Quick Shift](/card/32040).
 * [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022): flipping between Solid/Phased meets the requirement to trigger this so this lets you ready up to use another basic defense or save it for a basic thwart/attack. This is better than [Indomitable](/card/01082) because it's usable in the hero phase.
 * [Plan B](/card/27024): with the way the turn structure works, there's a good chance you'll have a card or two laying around before the hero phase ends and this lets you convert that to more damage before you re-draw.
 * [Deft Focus](/card/16024): most of your hero specific cards are Superpowers (except [Lockheed](/card/32032), [Kitty's Room](/card/32033), and [Phased and Confused](/card/32036)).

#### **Cards not included**
 * [Hard to Ignore](/card/16017): with the timing of things, this will never get to ignore crisis and trigger [Intangible Interference](/card/32035) unless you take damage (ending with Phased after the attack ends). It's also only limited to the main scheme.
 * [Not Today!](/card/38016)/[Expert Defense](/card/03033)/[Never Back Down](/card/14014)/[Desperate Defense](/card/09015): defense events that only works *after* you're defending isn't very efficient since ideally you want to play defense events after you're exhausted. [Never Back Down](/card/14014)/[Desperate Defense](/card/09015) allows for an extra ready but isn't as efficient as [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022) since you can't just leave it in play.
 * [Side Step](/card/14015): similar function to [Jump Flip](/card/27014) but removing 2 threat is often more valuable than doing 1 damage.
 * [Warning](/card/09021): was errata'd to no longer be a defense.
 * [X-Gene](/card/38019): the cards this can affect compared to [Deft Focus](/card/16024) doesn't overcome the fact that you'd have to be in alter-ego to play it making this awkward to play if you draw it after turn 1.

name: Fight the Future!
description_md: **_The future is now; chaos is its name. What better way to fight back chaos than with a healthy dose of your own?_** Like with any Adam Warlock deck, the #1 priorities are the 2 [Mystic Senses](/card/21037). [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) and [Soul World](/card/21033) are also high on this list- the former 3 being his main draw engine, the latter being the recovery. [Warlock's Cape](/card/21035) is important as well for multiple activations, as are the resource generators, chiefly [Karmic Staff](/card/21034) and [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029). After that, chaos ensues, and the search for the truth begins. We will have many options turn to turn in our quest for the truth, but that's the name of this game. We specialize in chaos, be it either from the extra encounter card from [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191), the extra encounter card from deck out, or the attacks you will withstand as you slog it out in Hero form. **The Fight** Fortunately, Adam's kit seems made to fight back against this dark future, as he has competent thwart and attack events coupled with the ability to play literally every aspect card in the game (albeit at 1 copy). This, to me, makes him ideally situated to take advantage of as many low-cost cards as possible, leading to a different kind of consistency. With only 3 cards in this deck costing 3 or more (2 of which are allies playable with [Summoning Spell](/card/21055)), you will usually find something productive to do with most of the cards in your hand. And considering we have a focus on colors over basics, Battle Mage gets more value, [Cosmic Awareness](/card/21039) becomes a 2 cost for ~5 threat, and [Karmic Blast](/card/21038) a 2 for ~6 damage, often even higher than those averages. And when the cards you are discarding are easy to play, [Quantum Magic](/card/21040) becomes that much better as well. Considering we are often starting with a 7 card hand and an extra 2 with the MSs, obviously this can add up quickly. For individual card choices, we look at what can get the most benefit for the least cost. What this amounts to regarding each aspect: - **Aggression:** 2 resources- 1 of which eats toughs and the other pays by itself for two upgrades ([Combat Training](/card/01057) and [Martial Prowess](/card/10018)), as well as a 1 cost 1-5 damage ([Magic Attack](/card/21043)). - **Justice:** A 1 cost confuse (["Think Fast!"](/card/19031)), a 0 cost permanent draw ([Skilled Investigator](/card/04047)), a 0 cost -side scheme notwithstanding- draw 3 ([One Way or Another](/card/22015)), a 1 cost 2-4 threat removal ([Multitasking](/card/15013)), and a 1 cost 1-4 threat removal ([Zone of Silence](/card/21050)) - **Leadership:** A 1 cost permanent resource generator ([Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029)), a 2 cost [Nick Fury](/card/01084) or [Beast](/card/33011) ([Summoning Spell](/card/21055)) a 2 cost way to instantly recur them ([Rapid Response](/card/08031)), and the resource needed to play these bigger cards more efficiently. - **Protection:** A 0 cost permanent minion removal-esque ([Pinned Down](/card/33034)), a 1 cost permanent retaliate in [Dauntless](/card/16016) (with Symbiote Suit), a 1 cost status clearer ([The Night Nurse](/card/09019)), a 1 cost -villain attack notwithstanding- treachery cancel ([Get Behind Me!](/card/01078)), and a 0 cost prevent all damage ([Shield Spell](/card/21061)) With all the upgrades out, and with how easy it is to get them out, it's easy to see the majority of your deck in only a turn or two once you get set up, especially with all the card discarding you are doing. We minimize the number of greens in deck as that is the color that gets the least value off the Battle Mage ability. **Other considerations:** [Kaluu](/card/21014) and [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) are both excellent allies for any deck that can run them. The problem I find with this deck in particular is that they just don't do enough on paper for me to include them. You want to hit [Nick Fury](/card/01084) or [Beast](/card/33011) with [Summoning Spell](/card/21055) pretty much 10 out of 10 times over either of those, since drawing cards and getting resources do more for setup and longevity than a single event, as, in my experience, the deck has no shortage of things you can usually do in a turn, apart from extending or needing resources to do them. I could see BV being brought in over something like [Dauntless](/card/16016), which feels like filler most of the time; more games might make me see the light. [Deft Focus](/card/16024) is a card I so badly want to play in here. With 7 superpower cards it seems like a natural fit. But with already 3 resource generators it just missed the cut. I'm sure you could throw it in here for 41 cards; I just elected not to. **Closing Thoughts** I will say this Adam Warlock build is most definitely not a beginner's friend - you really need to know what you're doing and weigh each turn carefully in order to not be overrun by nasty encounter cards/villain activations. Symbiote Suit could very easily prove to be your undoing if you play it before your team is prepared to deal with the extra encounters, or if you're playing against a particularly difficult scenario. A leadership teammate with many blockers is always nice to have. All said, there are likely other/better options I simply overlooked. A deck like this lends itself to quite a bit of personal preference and individual tinkering and tweaking from game to game; not to mention personal cardpool availability (14 packs seems like a ton). My first impression with AW precon was not great, it just didn’t seem to click for me. But I gave it another try, and I've had a blast with it so far; try AW out if you're looking for something different, fun, and chaotic to bring to the table! **_The future is bleak, but we fight nonetheless. The truth is out there..._**

description_md:
Not saying this deck is finished, but I wanted to play around with an idea.

I picked up Wolverine and Gambit at the same time and played them both through Rhino. While Wolverine had plenty of damage, he lacked threat management. So I got looking at Gambit and realized he had a lot of cards that made sense for Wolverine.

I decided to swap their decks, keeping only the basics, but they didn't exactly line up, so I splashed in just enough cards to make them both valid and decent.

While far from perfect, they are both suitable for 1 handed play.

name: Gambit Villain Deck Energy
description_md:
**Premise**

Using [_Remy Lebeau_](/card/37001b) And getting two high-value villain cards revealed can be a paint, but not with this set up. I have included as many cards as I could think of to fix this issue.


**Method**

- [_Armor_](/card/38012) and [_Colossus_](/card/32048) are ready to take a big hit

- [_Black Widow_](/card/01075) and [_Get Behind Me!_](/card/01078) are ready to take care of unforeseen activations that would cause major issues.

- [_Defiance_](/card/26018) and [_Preemptive Strike_](/card/05014) are ready to negate or reverse boost icons

- [_Target Acquired_](/card/08024) and [_Defiance_](/card/26018) are ready to negate a Boost Ability

-  The support cards and [_Mutant Education_](/card/37021) are ready to draw more cards 


**Highlight**

My favorite addition to the deck is [_Pulse Grenade_](/card/17023) thematically it feels like Gambit charges up a pocket rock. These are some of the nicest cards for managing the top of the villain deck because in addition to the damage, you can have three of them in play at a time and you can save them until you need them. They unlock the other cards that handle the same issue to be more flexibly used as resources as needed. 


**Cons**

This strategy works great when going from Alter-ego to Hero, but not so much the other way around. The healing from [_Endurance_](/card/05023) and [_X-Mansion_](/card/32049) should help to survive going to hero form without using the recovery action. If this becomes too much of an issue, I may use [_What Doesn't Kill Me_](/card/27016), [_Down Time_](/card/05033) and/or [_Symbiote Suit_](/card/27191) to set up for rounds with big heals.

name: Avengers Poker Night
description_md:
Leadership is normally pretty straight forward and a bit boring personally.  The [Sneak Attack](/card/23017) strategy allows you to play high-cost allies that you'd not often get out.  An Asgardian/Avenger deck using [Beta Ray Bill](/card/17012) and [Heimdall](/card/06020) with heroes Thor or Valkyrie is fun, but Capt'n A can defend and ready all day, surviving this strategy better than the Asgardians.

Strategy:  Mulligan for one of the six resource generators/savers and build those up over the game.  Also keep any [Shield Block](/card/03005)s.  Use [Sneak Attack](/card/23017) along with [Go Down Swinging](/card/23019) and [Save the Day](/card/23018) to get out allies cheaply and get the most out of their cost before the end of the phase.  Once your generators are up, you can pay for an ally to come out and use them for their high stats while still defending with the Capt'n for the shield's retaliate.  Keep using those 0-cost discard attacks/thwarts just before they run out of health, and use allies to block minions.  All of the Captain's cards are good, so use them to stay flexible.

With the Capt'n defending attacks, he'll slowly lose health, so it seems better to use [Down Time](/card/05033) rather than squeeze in another resource helper like [Helicarrier](/card/01092).  Prioritize that with [Steve's Apartment](/card/03007).  You'll find less chump blockers at the beginning of the game until your resource gens are setup.

Cards I chose not to use:  [Maria Hill](/card/01067) is always a multiplayer fave, but I used White Tiger for the card draw and stat line in solo.  [Captain Marvel](/card/04032) is out because there's no energy synergy in this deck.  Hard not to include [Endurance](/card/05023) in every deck, but I'd rather flip down and use [Steve's Apartment](/card/03007) and [Down Time](/card/05033) since there are so many high thwart allies and [Save the Day](/card/23018)s.  [Call for Aid](/card/12015) would get allies in hand, but I'd rather just include more allies. 

A higher number low-cost ally leadership deck with [Avengers Tower](/card/04021), [The Triskelion](/card/01073), and [Stinger](/card/12014) with [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) and [Band Together](/card/21018) is undoubtedly a better deck.  This is a gambling deck to get [Sneak Attack](/card/23017), an ally, and [Save the Day](/card/23018) or [Go Down Swinging](/card/23019) in the same hand.  When it all comes together, it feels great.  Voltron and Sneak decks are way more fun for me.

name: Storm Leadership vs. Risky Business Take 2
description_md:
This is the deck I used in Season 14 Round 2 of the Solo Champions League vs. Risky Business with the Wrecking Crew modular set.   It was pretty easy to stall and set-up.  The main think that slowed me down most games was having to deal with the high HP Wrecking Crew minions. 

Storm is good.  Didn't even use the weather card that made things -1 ATK.  Game Time was great once I got an ally set up with a Danger Room Training and I was able to flip back and forth to Alter Ego without too much worry so I could use Utopia to help keep allies around.

Game 2 - Clean win in 8 rounds.  15 HP left on Storm and Allies

Game 3 - Clean win in 9 rounds.  13 HP left on Storm and Allies

name: The X-Avenger Supreme Rogue
description_md:
Hi everyone! Let met present you my first published deck!

With this deck I tried to create some synergies in order to have many ressources generators and many readies. When totally built, with the readies and [Rogue's Jacket](/card/38004), in one turn:
- Rogue can deal up to 9 damages
- Rogue can thwart up to 9 threats

Here are some interactions you can have during a game:
- Ressources:
  - [Clea](/card/09013) allows you to play the [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026). She is also a cheap ally who go back to the deck when defeated. Then she can come back a lot during a game and then, maximize your chance to play the Sorcerer Supreme.
  - [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) allows you to play [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026). He is a 3-cost ally (or two with his reponse) and has the Avenger trait, which allows you to play [Quincarrier](/card/08023). Then the objective is to keep [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) alive until you have [Quincarrier](/card/08023) in your hand.
  - [Deft Focus](/card/16024) & [X-Gene](/card/38019) are low-cost generators for Rogue's cards ans can be played easily.


- Readies:
 - [Utopia](/card/33020) is great with 6 X-Men allies.
 - [Professor X](/card/32019) can ready her if [Utopia](/card/33020) is not in play.
 - [Energy Transfer](/card/38007) is great since it readies, heals & deals 2 damage. [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) does the same minus the damage.


- Tough: My second goal with this deck is to have many Tough status cards. Between [Polaris](/card/32012), [Armor](/card/38102) and [Bulletproof Protector](/card/32009), you can have many options. And with [Hard Knocks](/card/19016), you can deal damage & tough in a heavy-minions scenarios.

I am aware that this is an expensive deck and it takes time to fully build [Rogue](/card/38001a). It had been tested true solo against expert [Klaw](/card/01113) & Reavers modular set and I will try it with another scenarios.

In the meantime, feel free to give me some feedbacks. Would you change some cards or all of it?

And for those you read this, thank you!
